DOC.brief_summary: Circulating tumor DNA detection and quantification in patients with ovarian cancer.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Circulating Tumoral DNA in Ovarian Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Technique development: In a first step, the different available techniques will be evaluated for specificity and sensibility using serial dilutions of cell lines with or without TP53 mutation. Validation: The tumor DNA detection rate will be estimated from patient's blood with ovarian cancer. The investigators will study 25 patients to obtain at least 15 patients bearing a TP53 mutation that could be characterized in the primitive tumor or metastasis. With those 15 patients, the investigators will determine the most sensitive technique and the best cost/efficiency ratio.
DOC.criteria: Age > or = 18 years. Patient with invasive ovarian cancer stage II to IV from FIGO classification. Patient treated by surgery. Patient with tumor or metastasis available for TP53 status characterization Patient able to stand a blood collection. Signed written informed consent approved by AFSSAPS and CPP. Patient without social protection / insurance. Borderline ovarian tumor. Non carcinoma ovarian tumor Patient with invasive ovarian cancer 5 years before diagnosis Current pregnancy and lactation. All social, medical, psychological, situations making the study impossible. Person deprived of liberty.
